channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: China’s gig workers stress over their incomes as Baidu ‘silly radish’ robotaxis flood the streets
item.description: More than 500 electric robotaxis built by Baidu Inc. currently ply Wuhan's streets, with plans for an additional 1,000 to be deployed by year-end.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: Bank of England makes first interest rate cut since pandemic in nail-bitingly close vote
item.description: The “finely balanced” 5-4 vote signals the Bank's ongoing caution to further reductions, with no guidance given on where interest rates may settle.

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: Americans: If you want to move abroad because of the election, Spain is your best bet
item.description: Looking to leave the U.S. amid the political upheaval? If you can do your job remotely, research shows that Spain comes out on top.

item.title: Investment Manager Selection Is Hotting Up. Are You Ready for the Tough Questions?
item.description: Investment managers are being caught off guard by tougher questions from an increasingly sophisticated allocator market. Are you prepared for your next beauty parade?

item.title: Cities no longer need to be rich to be smart as AI ‘levels out the playing field,’ urban experts say
item.description: Data can help cities who are not that rich become 'smart' and the cost of data collection is coming down because of advances in AI.

item.title: Measuring Corporate Impact: The Gold Is in the Details
item.description: Do the products and services of the companies you invest in create negative or positive material outcomes?

item.title: Trump tried to sway the Fed and now Powell is fighting back
item.description: Fighting words: "We're a non political agency. We don't want to be involved in politics in any way."
